Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2014 01:55PM jedimom wrote: Hola everyone, Had my rad simulation & tats yesterday will start daily tx next week.  I'm just as worried about the rads as the chemo but for different reasons.  I know the SE of rads are nothing like chemo.  But I've been told blistering is likely & permanent deformity may happen.  I had a lumpectomy & my breast is a smaller than my other, but it's managable.  If there is anymore shrinkage it will not be.  I would love to hear from any ladies who have been through it or are going through it. Peace & Wellness to all.
Posts.Title: Fall Rads 2014 writinghelps sas-schatzi

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2014 02:49PM jedimom wrote: Hi PontiacPeggy, Thanks for your post.  It was my RO who told me about the rad SE, brittle ribs, lung exposure, blistering, change in shape & size of the breast.  For me she believed after treatment my breast would be smaller & firmer, "lopsided" she said.  I guess she was preparing me for all possibilities. I'm relieved to hear that this isn't an absolute w/ rads.
Posts.Title: Fall Rads 2014 writinghelps sas-schatzi

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2014 03:09PM jedimom wrote: Hi Susug, Thanks for sharing, you sound like you are doing great.  I'm moving forward w/ positive thoughts & expectations, like PontiacPeggy.  I made it through chemo & I'll get through this too. Thanks again for sharing, it helps alot to hear from experience.   P.S.  I'm in Texas too.

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2015 12:13PM jedimom wrote: Can you have IBC & IDC? I finished tx for IDC in Feb. (right lumpie, chemo, & rads), now I'm taking my Tamoxifen. But now I'm seeing some strange things in good boob (left). Several weeks ago I had a single episode of a small, no really small amount of a clear nipple discharge from the left. Now in the last week I'm seeing little red bumps and small bluish area on the boob, with some soreness in the ribs and the breast itself.  So, does anyone know can/ does a body produce both types of cancer?  Luv to all,

Posts.Content: jedimom wrote: Hello, I will be starting my chemo next week cytoxan & taxotere.  As with most of us I have to keep working & care for my family.  Does anyone have any recommendations i.e, vitamins, certain foods or any tricks that help battle the chemo side effects?  Thank you  Dx 6/2/2014, IDC, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER-/PR+, HER2- Surgery 7/3/2014 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Chemotherapy 9/2/2014 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 12/9/2014 Breast Hormonal Therapy Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo - sickness jedimom SpecialK

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2014 02:05PM jedimom wrote: Hello ladies, I'm 3 into a 4 treatment string of taxotere & Cytoxan.  My chemo bag includes a large bottle of SmartWater, 2 or 3 books. One funny, one cheesy romance, & one educational (usually I don't get to this one, priorities you know). Also, I carry my Android, gotta CandyCrush, & lots of snacks.  But I must say I usually end up chatting w/ the other patients & my chemo nurse.  I've met some very nice people, & have learned some things, the time flys.  I lost my hair 13 days after my first tx,I have a wig but, just don't feel comfortable in it.  I wear lots of different hats. Love to all, god bless.  If we can take it, we can make it!
